meanings.definition: The point or level at which something is cut off or stopped.
meanings.sent1: The teacher set the cutoffs for the project deadline.
meanings.sent2: The power outage occurred at the cutoffs of the storm.
meanings.sent3: At the cutoffs of the movie, the screen suddenly went blank.
meanings.sent4: The negotiations reached a cutoffs, leaving both parties unsatisfied.
meanings.sent5: The cutoffs between night and day are often the most beautiful moments.

meanings.definition: Shorts or pants that have been cut off at the knee or higher.
meanings.sent1: She wore cutoffs to the beach to stay cool.
meanings.sent2: The kids loved playing in their cutoffs during summer.
meanings.sent3: The cutoffs she made from old jeans were surprisingly stylish.
meanings.sent4: His cutoffs were so short, they almost looked like boxers.
meanings.sent5: The fashion trend of cutoffs never seems to go out of style.
